options.content:
# **üöÄ kube-burner-ocp virt clone benchmark dashboard**

This dashboard provides deep insights into the results of the virt-clone benchmark execution using kube-burner-ocp. For a deep dive into workload parameters and metric definitions, refer to the [official kube-burner-ocp documentation](https://kube-burner.github.io/kube-burner-ocp/latest/#virt-clone).

### ‚öôÔ∏è How to configure your view

Use the dropdown selectors at the top of the dashboard to filter the results:

- **Run UUID üîΩ:** Select the unique identifier for your benchmark execution to filter all visualizations for that specific test run.
- **Latency Percentile üìä:** Toggle between median (50th) for typical performance or tail latencies (90th/95th/99th) to identify worst-case bottlenecks in your infrastructure.

üìå **NOTE:**
- All latency metrics in this dashboard are reported in seconds.
- Since the OS image is provisioned through persistent storage instead of being pulled directly into the `virt-launcher` pod‚Äôs local directory, this scenario results in the creation and binding of DataVolumes and PVCs.
- At the moment, kube-burner-ocp has a known issue in which the `nodeName` field is not populated when executing the virt-clone workload. See [\[BUG\] nodeName missing in Elasticsearch documents when using virt-clone scenario](https://github.com/kube-burner/kube-burner-ocp/issues/378)

targets.query: jobName:"create-clone-vms" AND metricName.keyword:"vmiLatencyMeasurement" AND jobIteration: "0" AND uuid:"$uuid"

panels.description: This panel compares the average wall-clock duration of each benchmark phase across all iterations. It highlights which job consumes the most time, identifying potential infrastructure bottlenecks.
panels.title: Average phase duration comparison

panels.description:
Breaks down the total VM creation time into six distinct phases:

   1. VMI provisioning (Created): Captures API overhead and initial storage preparation. In Immediate binding mode, this includes the full DataVolume/PVC provisioning and binding time.
   2. Controller handoff (Pending): Measures virt-controller efficiency in processing the VMI and generating the launcher Pod spec while waiting for storage availability.
   3. Scheduling & Binding (Scheduling): Critical for WaitForFirstConsumer storage. Captures the dual latency of the Scheduler selecting a node and the Storage Provisioner binding the volume to that node's topology.
   4. Node & Mount prep (Scheduled): Captures Kubelet overhead, including pulling the virt-launcher image and the physical attachment/mounting of storage volumes to the worker node.
   5. Hypervisor startup (Running): Confirms the hypervisor is launched and all storage/network interfaces are attached and accessible to the virtual hardware.
   6. Virtual Machine readiness (Ready): Time from Running to the Ready condition. Confirms all DataVolumes are ready and the KubeVirt Guest Agent has established a connection with the host handler.
panels.title: VM provisioning lifecycle breakdown

panels.description:
Breaks down the total VM creation time into six distinct phases:

   1. VMI provisioning (Created): Captures API overhead and initial storage preparation. In Immediate binding mode, this includes the full DataVolume/PVC provisioning and binding time.
   2. Controller handoff (Pending): Measures virt-controller efficiency in processing the VMI and generating the launcher Pod spec while waiting for storage availability.
   3. Scheduling & Binding (Scheduling): Critical for WaitForFirstConsumer storage. Captures the dual latency of the Scheduler selecting a node and the Storage Provisioner binding the volume to that node's topology.
   4. Node & Mount prep (Scheduled): Captures Kubelet overhead, including pulling the virt-launcher image and the physical attachment/mounting of storage volumes to the worker node.
   5. Hypervisor startup (Running): Confirms the hypervisor is launched and all storage/network interfaces are attached and accessible to the virtual hardware.
   6. Virtual Machine readiness (Ready): Time from Running to the Ready condition. Confirms all DataVolumes are ready and the KubeVirt Guest Agent has established a connection with the host handler.
panels.title: VM provisioning lifecycle breakdown

panels.description: Displays the distribution of VMs across physical nodes to track workload density and cluster balance.
panels.title: Distribution of VMs per host

panels.description: Displays the distribution of VMs across physical nodes to track workload density and cluster balance.
panels.title: VM ready latency per host (Average)

list.description: Filters the dashboard to show performance metrics for the selected virt-clone benchmark run ID
list.label: Run UUID
list.name: uuid

list.description: Selects the P-value (50th to 99th) for VM and DV latency calculations
list.label: Latency Percentile
list.name: percentile
